name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Construction Pack including a Methodology and JESA to be assembled , uploaded and transmitted on InEight before works commence
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Survey Set out as per contract drawings and specification, capturing pre-construction levels where needed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prior to starting works, Ensure that the construction drawings are both IFC and the Current Version.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - After set-out and prior to installation of signs and pavement markings.
SECTION 3 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL – ROADMARKING
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Paint shall comply with NZTA M/7 – Specification for Road Marking Paints
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - After set-out and prior to installation of signs and pavement markings.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The design and location of the markings shall be in accordance with MOTSAM and the details on the Drawings. Markings shown on the Drawings shall have precedence over any MOTSAM details however the Contractor shall advise the Engineer of any ambiguities prior to setting out.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The surface to be marked must be swept and cleaned so not to have any dirt, loose chip or detritus sitting on top of it. The surface must be checked and accepted by the Engineer prior to any marking being carried out.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Removal of existing pavement marking shall be carried out in accordance with The New Zealand Road markers Federation Line Removal Guide (http://www.nzrf.co.nz). The method selected shall ensure that old markings are not visible, especially in the wet.
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
